subject: Technology
title: Sputnik: The Beep Heard Round the World
description: A 60-second lesson on Sputnik: The Beep Heard Round the World.

hook.text: On October 4, 1957, a metal sphere the size of a beach ball changed the course of history.

buildup.text: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik, the first artificial satellite. It orbited Earth every 96 minutes.

discovery.text: Sputnik did almost nothing. It beeped. But that beep could be heard on radios around the world.

twist.text: America panicked. If the Soviets could put a satellite up, they could put a nuclear bomb anywhere.

climax.text: Sputnik triggered the space race, the founding of NASA, and a revolution in science education.

punchline.text: A beeping ball in orbit terrified a superpower into action.

quiz.question: What did Sputnik actually do in orbit?
